page.title: 17 E.T.C.
page.content: E.T.C. (Ellesmere Timber Company) supplies most of the local hardware stores and is also one of the main suppliers of jobs for Ellesmere.Sixty percent of the wood comes locally from Wales and the other forty percent comes from Scotland.The wood they use is soft wood.At E.T.C. there are about one hundred and twenty five workers.There is no waste because the sawdust that is left over from the machine is sucked through a tube into a pile and used for chipboard.There are big flexible saws called band saws. They fit into pieces of machinery and spin round to cut the wood.They have to be cleaned and sharpened every 4 hours.In one production line they make eight hundred slabs of wood a day.
